title: Company Shares of S&T Bancorp, Inc. (NASDAQ:STBA) Rally 0.85%
text:
by Jason Weyman August 17, 2015 
Shares of S&T Bancorp, Inc. (NASDAQ:STBA) appreciated by 0.85% during the past week but lost 0.81% on a 4-week basis. In the past week, the shares have outperformed the S&P 500 by 0.18% and the outperformance increases to 0.86% for the last 4 weeks. 
The company shares have rallied 23.26% in the past 52 Weeks. On July 22, 2015 The shares registered one year high of $32.88 and one year low was seen on October 8, 2014 at $23.07. The 50-day moving average is $30.58 and the 200 day moving average is recorded at $28.88. S&P 500 has rallied 6.56% during the last 52-weeks. The company has received recommendation from many analysts. The shares have been rated as hold from 3 Wall Street Analysts. 2 analysts have suggested buy for the company. S&T Bancorp Inc. is up 16.59% in the last 3-month period. Year-to-Date the stock performance stands at 5.09%. 
S&T Bancorp, Inc. (NASDAQ:STBA) : On Friday heightened volatility was witnessed in S&T Bancorp, Inc. (NASDAQ:STBA) which led to swings in the share price. The shares opened for trading at $30.07 and hit $30.79 on the upside , eventually ending the session at $30.74, with a gain of 1.96% or 0.59 points. The heightened volatility saw the trading volume jump to 48,310 shares. The 52-week high of the share price is $32.88 and the company has a market cap of $1,070 million. The 52-week low of the share price is at $23.07 . 
Currently the company Insiders own 3% of S&T Bancorp Inc. Company shares. In the past six months, there is a change of -12.96% in the total insider ownership. Institutional Investors own 45.8% of Company shares. During last 3 month period, -0.46% of total institutional ownership has changed in the company shares. On a different note, The Company has disclosed insider buying and selling activities to the Securities Exchange, The director, of S&T Bancorp Inc, Gibson James Thomas had unloaded 25,000 shares at $31.3 per share in a transaction on July 24, 2015. The total value of transaction was $782,500. The Insider information was revealed by the Securities and Exchange Commission in a Form 4 filing.
